intro: Herniaria parnassica, commonly known as the Parnassian bladderwort, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and is typically found in alpine and subalpine habitats. The plant is characterized by its compact growth form, with small, rounded leaves and delicate pink or white flowers. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in open, sunny environments. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
